articles.title: Korean People's Spirit of Self-Reliance Praised
articles.content:
Korean People's Spirit of Self-Reliance Praised
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Foreigners who visited the DPRK expressed deep admiration at the heroic struggle of the Korean people who are working miracles and feats while overcoming all sorts of hardships and difficulties in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude.
					 Ksor Phuoc, chairman of the National Council of the Vietnamese National Assembly, said that through visit to the Three-Revolution Exhibition he came to know well about the economic potential of the DPRK, adding that the Korean people built a powerful, independent national economy under the difficult conditions where they were hard pressed for everything.
					
					 He expressed the belief that the Korean people would achieve greater successes in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A member of the delegation of the World Intellectual Property Organization said that the visit to the DPRK convinced him that the West's propaganda about the DPRK is distortion of facts.
					
					 Pyongyang has turned into a wonderful city thanks to the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the powerful strength of the Korean people closely rallied around them, he added.
					
					 S. P. Pathak, director of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il, said that the reality of the DPRK proves that there is nothing impossible for it and only victory in store for it when it depends on the inexhaustible strength of the popular masses.
					
					 Self-reliance can be described as a mode of making revolution peculiar to the Korean people, he said, expressing belief that the army and people of the DPRK would make greater progress in their efforts for achieving the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Independent Foreign Policy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Independent Foreign Policy
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- The independent foreign policy of the DPRK serves as a driving force for developing the fair international relations, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 All the external activities of the DPRK are strictly subordinated to embodying and adhering to the idea of independence, peace and friendship in the international relations. 
					
					 The DPRK has positively pushed ahead with the development of sound international relations by solving all issues arising in the foreign relations as required by global independence from the Juche-oriented viewpoint.
					
					  The DPRK has firmly defended the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and accelerated the world-wide onward movement for independence even under the complicated international situation by positively enforcing an independent and principled foreign policy. 
					
					 Despite the grim situation, the DPRK has firmly held fast to and pursued the independent and principled foreign policy under the uplifted banner of Songun. The DPRK has decisively foiled the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their followers for military aggression and their all sorts of threats and, at the same time,  established and developed the friendly, cooperative and good neighborly relations with those countries that respect the sovereignty of the DPRK and desire to improve the relations with it.
					
					 By pursuing the independent and principled foreign policy the DPRK has made a great contribution to destroying the old international order, establishing the sound international relations and achieving the historic cause of humankind for making the whole world independent. 
					
					 The DPRK's foreign policy and its external activities have enjoyed sympathy from many countries of the world and serve as an example to be followed by them as it has firmly maintained the principle of independence and never allowed any concession over the revolutionary principles. 
					
					 It has positively contributed to boosting the friendly and cooperative relations with non-aligned countries and other developing countries and strengthening the unity of the anti-imperialist independent forces of the world. 
					
					 The DPRK will consistently follow its independent foreign policy in the future, too, to enhance its international prestige and say, strengthen the international solidarity with the Korean revolution and accelerate the cause of the global independence.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Outbursts Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Outbursts Blasted
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak in a recent "speech on the state administration" let loose such reckless remarks pulling up the DPRK as "the north should drop such outdated behavior stirring up conflict in the south and opt for cooperation."
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard: The "conflict in the south," in other word the conflict in the south Korean society, is not caused by somebody's prodding but a natural product of the structural contradiction in that society. 
					
					 The commentary cites just a few examples proving that it is none other than Lee who is entirely to blame for deepening the "conflict in the south."
					
					 The above-said ridiculous remarks made by Lee are intended to tide over the serious ruling crisis sparked off by his regime's unpopular, treacherous and anti-reunification acts by passing the buck for it to others. This, however, only brings to light the true colors of the traitors hell-bent on confrontation with compatriots. 
					
					 It is impossible to put an end not only to the "conflict in the south" but to the distrust and confrontation between the north and the south as long as such philistines who hate admitting their wrongs and traitors who seek a way out in the confrontation with compatriots are allowed to ride roughshod. 
					
					 All Koreans are, therefore, called upon to pool their efforts and wage a more dynamic struggle for making a clean sweep of the group of traitors, still sticking to their old sycophantic, fascist and anti-reunification attitude.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Intention to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Accused
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Intention to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Accused
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) - The Lee Myung Bak group is pushing the inter-Korean relations to uncontrollable catastrophe while opposing dialogue and cooperation between fellow countrymen and openly pursuing confrontation and war with the north from the outset of the year.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday carries a signed article blasting this unchanged intention to escalate the confrontation with the north. 
					
					 It says:
					
					 A scrutiny into the policy for this year shaped by the south Korean Minister of Unification on the occasion of the New Year shows that it does not clarify the stand and will to respect and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the foundation and lifeline for improving the inter-Korean relations. This indicates that they often talk about what they call "dialogue" and "cooperation" but, in fact, they have no intention to implement them in the new year, too. 
					
					 This is more clearly evidenced by the "four important tasks" proposed by the ministry. 
					
					 The above-said tasks consider as their keynote the "policy of co-existence and co-prosperity" which is unanimously censured and condemned by all the fellow countrymen for being a treacherous theory of confrontation and they are aimed at persistently pursuing the policy of confrontation with the north under the signboard of it. 
					
					 The above-said four tasks proposed by the ministry the keynote of which are "dialogue and cooperation" and "co-existence and co-prosperity" glaringly reveal the sinister intention to evade the criminal responsibility for having driven the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe last year at any cost, mislead public opinion at home and abroad and escalate the confrontation with the north in a more cunning and vicious manner. 
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that Lee Myung Bak more openly betrayed his confrontation hysteria than ever before when receiving a report on the work of the ministry. This was an open agitation that it is necessary to give up inter-Korean dialogue and economic cooperation with the north, claiming that there is no need to pursue them, and head for confrontation and war. 
					
					 If the group persistently pursues the moves for confrontation with the north while denying the historic inter-Korean joint declarations this year, too, the Korean nation will never pardon the group of traitors. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to properly understand the strong desire and will of the whole nation and roll back at once the traitorous policy of confrontation, urges the article.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Commemorated in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Commemorated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 were formed with due ceremonies in Nigeria and Denmark on Jan. 12. 
					 M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected chairmen of the preparatory committees at the ceremonies.
					
					 The Nigerian preparatory committee set the days from January 12 to April 30 as a commemoration period and decided to actively hold colorful events for widely introducing the great personality and immortal feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and the Korean people's struggle and supporting the cause of Korea's reunification in the period. 
					
					 The Danish preparatory committee decided to arrange colorful political and cultural events, including a rally, a remembrance meeting and a film show, on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the February holiday.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Hailed in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Hailed in Various Countries
Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Sessions of reading the joint New Year editorial published by the newspapers of the party, the army and the youth league in the DPRK were held by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association on Jan. 8 and 12.
					 Speeches were made at the reading sessions.
					
					Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, said that the joint editorial serves as highly important guidelines reflecting General Secretary Kim Jong Il's Songun idea and far-reaching plan on the prosperity of the DPRK.
					
					He hoped that the Korean people would increase the might of Songun in every way, intensify the political and ideological offensive and create the speed of general advance in the era of Songun this year and thus make great strides in attaining the grand objective to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012 that marks the centennial birth anniversary of President
						Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, and other speakers expressed belief that the Korean people under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il would surely carry out the tasks for building a thriving nation and reunifying the country, laid down in the joint editorial, holding high the banner of Songun.
